movies.title: Astérix et les Vikings
movies.plot: After another raid in an empty village, the chief of the Vikings Timandahaf misunderstands the explanation of his druid Cryptograf that "fear gives wings to the dwellers" and believes that fear actually makes the villagers fly. They decide to chase the champion of fear in Gaul to learn how to fly and make them invincible warriors. Meanwhile, the nephew of Vitalstatistix, Justforkix, is sent from Parisium to the Gaulish village to become a man and Asterix and Obelix are assigned to train the youngster. The stupid son of Cryptograf, Olaf, listens to a conversation of the coward Justforkix with Asterix and Obelix and kidnaps him. While returning to the Viking village, Justforkix meets Abba, the daughter of Timandahaf, and they fall in love for each other. But the Machiavellian and ambitious Cryptograf plan to marry his son Olaf with Abba and become powerful. In the end, Asterix realizes that it is not fear that gives wings, it is love.
movies.simplePlot: After another raid in an empty village, the chief of the Vikings Timandahaf misunderstands the explanation of his druid Cryptograf that "fear gives wings to the dwellers" and believes that ...

biography.bio: Roger Carel was born on August 14, 1927 in Paris, France as Roger Bancharel. He is known for his work on The Twelve Tasks of Asterix (1976), Asterix and Cleopatra (1968) and Asterix the Gaul (1967).
biography.name: Roger Carel

biography.bio: Lorànt Deutsch was born on October 27, 1975 in Sablé-sur-Sarthe, Sarthe, France as László Matekovics. He is an actor and writer, known for Astérix et les Vikings (2006), Asterix and Obelix: Mansion of the Gods (2014) and Bienvenue chez les Rozes (2003). He has been married to Marie-Julie Baup since October 3, 2009. They have two children.
biography.name: Lorànt Deutsch

biography.bio: As of her youth, Sara Forestier revealed an artistic temperament, loving to write, to paint, and especially to act. When she was thirteen and half years old, she decided to accompany one of her friends to an audition. She took the audition with brilliance, and her career in the acting started here. She met an artistic agent and obtained minor parts in movies and TV movies until L'Esquive. Whereas Abdellatif Kechiche didn't want "true actors" for his movie, she succeeded in convincing by her talent and obtained the leading female role of the film. The movie and her performance were cheered. Now, she continues to shoot in varied films and will have her second leading role in a film adaptation of the novel of Lolita Pille, Hell, at the side of Nicolas Duvauchelle.
biography.name: Sara Forestier

biography.bio: Jacques Frantz was born on April 4, 1947 in Dijon, Côte-d'Or, France. He is an actor, known for G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra (2009), Heartbreaker (2010) and Astérix et les Vikings (2006).
biography.name: Jacques Frantz

biography.bio: Pierre Palmade was born on March 23, 1968 in Bordeaux, France. He is an actor and writer, known for Les nouveaux refus (2004), Nom de code: Balasko (1998) and Fête de la liberté: Du côté de chez Bedos (1998). He has been married to Véronique Sanson since June 27, 1995.
biography.name: Pierre Palmade

biography.bio: Pierre Tchernia was born on January 29, 1928 in Paris, France as Pierre Tcherniakowski. He was a writer and actor, known for Monsieur Cinéma (1967), Les enfants de la télé (1994) and Jeudi cinéma (1980). He was married to Françoise. He died on October 8, 2016 in Paris.
biography.name: Pierre Tchernia

biography.bio: Born in 1948 to French actress Annick Alane, this good-looking, eclectic thespian has never shown any disdain for any form of his art: theater (in which he served, among many others, Tchekhov, Shakespeare and Molière); musical comedy - both in England and in France ("Can Can", "South Pacific", "Peter Pan", "My Fair Lady"): television (which gave him the opportunity to embody historical figures such as Camille Desmoulins and Paul Ramadier); dubbing (Bernard Alane lent his voice to many a cartoon); and, of course cinema. His debut on the big screen exemplify his protean talent: comical in "Hibernatus", his first film (1969), he displays virile charm in his second movie "Mon oncle Benjamin". Unfortunately for film lovers, his appearances on the big screen have been irregular and generally too brief, for instance in his last feature to-date, "Agathe Cléry" (2008), where he only has a bit-part as one of Jean Rochefort's two sons.
biography.name: Bernard Alane

biography.bio: Marc Alfos was born in 1956 in France. He was an actor, known for Astérix et les Vikings (2006), Assassin's Creed II (2009) and Snow White: The Sequel (2007). He died on August 3, 2012 in France.
biography.name: Marc Alfos

biography.bio: Jules Azem is an actor, known for Astérix et les Vikings (2006).
biography.name: Jules Azem

biography.bio: Patrick Borg is an actor, known for Astérix et les Vikings (2006), SaturdayMan (2012) and The Getaway (2002).
biography.name: Patrick Borg

biography.bio: Philippe Catoire is an actor, known for Astérix et les Vikings (2006), Assassin's Creed II (2009) and Ragazzo (1983).
biography.name: Philippe Catoire

biography.bio: Bruno Dubernat is an actor, known for Astérix et les Vikings (2006), Dishonored (2012) and Paradise (2006).
biography.name: Bruno Dubernat

biography.bio: Luc Florian is an actor and writer, known for Astérix et les Vikings (2006), Madeline (1998) and Le roi des aulnes (1996).
biography.name: Luc Florian

biography.bio: Stéphane Fourreau is an actor and producer, known for Astérix et les Vikings (2006), Nina (2015) and La taupe 2 (2009).
biography.name: Stéphane Fourreau

biography.bio: Marion Game was born on July 31, 1942 in Casablanca, Morocco as Madeleine Game. She is an actress, known for Scènes de ménages (2009), Boulevard du Palais (1999) and Astérix et les Vikings (2006).
biography.name: Marion Game
